solo.topband.label: Solo, not just alone — stories from known faces
solo.hero.title: Going It Alone
solo.hero.subtitle: You prefer to handle things yourself, but sometimes you wonder if you're missing out on the support and connection that others seem to have.
solo.stir.line.0: Do you prefer to figure things out on your own?
solo.stir.line.1: Do you feel like you don't need help from others?
solo.stir.line.2: Do you sometimes feel isolated or lonely?
solo.stir.line.3: Do you wonder if you're missing something by going solo?
solo.stir.line.4: What would it feel like to let others in?
solo.emote.0.title: Independent
solo.emote.0.subtitle: Self-reliant and strong
solo.emote.1.title: Isolated
solo.emote.1.subtitle: Sometimes feeling alone
solo.emote.2.title: Proud
solo.emote.2.subtitle: Of what you've accomplished alone
solo.emote.3.title: Lonely
solo.emote.3.subtitle: Missing connection
solo.emote.4.title: Capable
solo.emote.4.subtitle: You can handle anything
solo.emote.5.title: Curious
solo.emote.5.subtitle: About what collaboration might offer

celeb.items.name: Steve Jobs
celeb.items.quote: "Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower."

celeb.items.name: Elon Musk
celeb.items.quote: "When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor."

celeb.items.name: Nelson Mandela
celeb.items.quote: "The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall."

solo.section.0.title: The Strength of Independence
solo.section.0.line: You've learned to rely on yourself and trust your own judgment.
solo.section.0.body: There's power in being self-sufficient. You know you can handle whatever comes your way, and that confidence has served you well.
solo.section.0.bullet.0: You prefer to make decisions on your own.
solo.section.0.bullet.1: You trust your instincts and abilities.
solo.section.0.bullet.2: You take pride in solving problems independently.
solo.section.0.nudge: Write down three things you've accomplished on your own that you're proud of.
solo.section.1.title: The Weight of Going Solo
solo.section.1.line: Sometimes carrying everything alone becomes heavy.
solo.section.1.body: While independence is valuable, there are times when going it alone can feel isolating or overwhelming. You might be missing out on support, different perspectives, or simply the joy of shared experiences.
solo.section.1.bullet.0: You feel like you have to handle everything yourself.
solo.section.1.bullet.1: You sometimes feel lonely or isolated.
solo.section.1.bullet.2: You wonder if you're missing out on connection.
solo.section.1.nudge: Ask yourself: 'What would it feel like to share one challenge with someone else?'
solo.section.2.title: The Art of Selective Connection
solo.section.2.line: You can be independent while still allowing others in.
solo.section.2.body: True strength isn't about never needing anyone — it's about choosing when and how to let others in while maintaining your independence.
solo.section.2.bullet.0: You're learning to be selective about who you let in.
solo.section.2.bullet.1: You're discovering the value of different perspectives.
solo.section.2.bullet.2: You're finding balance between independence and connection.
solo.section.2.nudge: Identify one area where you might benefit from another person's input or support.
solo.section.3.title: Building Meaningful Connections
solo.section.3.line: The right connections can enhance your independence rather than diminish it.
solo.section.3.body: When you find people who respect your independence while offering genuine support, you can have the best of both worlds — your strength and their support.
solo.section.3.bullet.0: You're seeking connections that honor your independence.
solo.section.3.bullet.1: You're learning to ask for help when it truly serves you.
solo.section.3.bullet.2: You're discovering that connection can strengthen rather than weaken you.
solo.section.3.nudge: Reach out to one person this week and share something you're working on, asking for their perspective.
solo.bridge.title: Independence and connection can coexist beautifully.
solo.bridge.body: Drishiq helps you honor your independent nature while exploring how selective connection can enhance rather than diminish your strength.
solo.how.0.d: Understand your solo patterns and their impact.
solo.how.1.d: Discover what kind of connections serve you best.
solo.how.2.d: Learn to let others in while maintaining your independence.
solo.how.3.d: Find ways to receive support without losing your autonomy.

giving_beyond.topband.label: Giving Beyond, not just generous — stories from known faces
giving_beyond.hero.title: Giving Beyond Limits
giving_beyond.hero.subtitle: You give so much of yourself that sometimes you forget where you end and others begin. Your generosity is beautiful, but it needs boundaries to be sustainable.
giving_beyond.stir.line.0: Do you give until you have nothing left for yourself?
giving_beyond.stir.line.1: Do you feel guilty when you can't help someone?
giving_beyond.stir.line.2: Do you put others' needs before your own consistently?
giving_beyond.stir.line.3: Do you feel resentful when your giving isn't appreciated?
giving_beyond.stir.line.4: What would it feel like to give from a place of abundance rather than depletion?
giving_beyond.emote.0.title: Generous
giving_beyond.emote.0.subtitle: Always ready to give
giving_beyond.emote.1.title: Drained
giving_beyond.emote.1.subtitle: Giving until empty
giving_beyond.emote.2.title: Resentful
giving_beyond.emote.2.subtitle: When giving isn't returned
giving_beyond.emote.3.title: Guilty
giving_beyond.emote.3.subtitle: When you can't help
giving_beyond.emote.4.title: Invisible
giving_beyond.emote.4.subtitle: Your needs go unnoticed
giving_beyond.emote.5.title: Wise
giving_beyond.emote.5.subtitle: Learning to give wisely

celeb.items.name: Mahatma Gandhi
celeb.items.quote: "The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others."

celeb.items.name: Michelle Obama
celeb.items.quote: "You can't pour from an empty cup. Take care of yourself first."

celeb.items.name: Fred Rogers
celeb.items.quote: "Look for the helpers. You will always find people who are helping."

celeb.items.name: Dalai Lama
celeb.items.quote: "Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them."

giving_beyond.section.0.title: The Gift of Generosity
giving_beyond.section.0.line: Your giving heart is one of your greatest strengths.
giving_beyond.section.0.body: You have a natural ability to see what others need and a desire to help. This generosity creates positive ripples in the world and brings meaning to your life.
giving_beyond.section.0.bullet.0: You're always looking for ways to help others.
giving_beyond.section.0.bullet.1: You find joy in making a difference in people's lives.
giving_beyond.section.0.bullet.2: You're known as someone who can be counted on.
giving_beyond.section.0.nudge: Write down three ways you've made a positive impact on others recently.
giving_beyond.section.1.title: When Giving Becomes Depleting
giving_beyond.section.1.line: Giving beyond your capacity leaves you empty.
giving_beyond.section.1.body: There's a difference between giving from abundance and giving from depletion. When you give beyond your capacity, you end up with nothing left for yourself or others.
giving_beyond.section.1.bullet.0: You give until you're physically and emotionally exhausted.
giving_beyond.section.1.bullet.1: You neglect your own needs to help others.
giving_beyond.section.1.bullet.2: You feel resentful when your giving isn't appreciated.
giving_beyond.section.1.nudge: Identify one area where you're giving beyond your capacity and set a boundary.
giving_beyond.section.2.title: The Art of Sustainable Giving
giving_beyond.section.2.line: True generosity comes from a place of abundance, not depletion.
giving_beyond.section.2.body: When you take care of yourself first, you have more to give to others. Sustainable giving means setting boundaries and ensuring you're filled up before you pour out.
giving_beyond.section.2.bullet.0: You're learning to say no when you're at capacity.
giving_beyond.section.2.bullet.1: You're prioritizing your own needs alongside others'.
giving_beyond.section.2.bullet.2: You're finding ways to give that energize rather than drain you.
giving_beyond.section.2.nudge: Create a list of activities that fill you up and commit to doing one daily.
giving_beyond.section.3.title: Giving That Transforms
giving_beyond.section.3.line: The most powerful giving empowers others to give too.
giving_beyond.section.3.body: When you give in a way that helps others become more capable and independent, you create a ripple effect of positive change that extends far beyond what you could do alone.
giving_beyond.section.3.bullet.0: You're teaching others to help themselves.
giving_beyond.section.3.bullet.1: You're creating opportunities for others to give back.
giving_beyond.section.3.bullet.2: You're building a community of mutual support.
giving_beyond.section.3.nudge: Think of one way you can help someone become more self-sufficient rather than dependent on your help.
giving_beyond.bridge.title: Your giving can be both generous and sustainable.
giving_beyond.bridge.body: Drishiq helps you find the balance between your generous nature and your need for self-care, so you can give from abundance rather than depletion.
giving_beyond.how.0.d: Understand your giving patterns and their impact on you.
giving_beyond.how.1.d: Learn to say no and set healthy limits.
giving_beyond.how.2.d: Develop routines that keep you filled up.
giving_beyond.how.3.d: Give in ways that help others become more capable.
